Sequence Information.Source: Amino acid substitution, bacteria-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: Guo L, Wambui J, Wang C, Broos J, Stephan R, Kuipers OP. 2024
Literature.Title: Rombocin, a Short Stable Natural Nisin Variant, Displays Selective Antimicrobial Activity against Listeria monocytogenes and Employs a Dual Mode of Action to Kill Target Bacterial Strains.

Sequence Information.Comments: Peptide design: A change I15 to K increased peptide activity.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (96%) toRombocin AActivity:  active against L. lactis MG1363 (MIC 0.78 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes LMG10470 or TT82E or LK132 (MIC 6.25-12.5 ug/ml), B. cereus CH-85 (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. aureus LMG10147 or LMG15975 MRSA (MIC 100 ug/ml), and E. faecium LMG11423 or LMG16003 or LMG16216 (MIC 50 ug/ml) anti-VRE. Est.Jan2024;
